evs.name: Driver’s license renewal application
evs.description: Application form submitted by the interested party for the renewal of the driver’s license, completed at the offices of the competent authorities or through Citizen Service Centers (KEP).

evs.name: Police ID card or passport
evs.description: Presentation of a police ID card or passport for identification of the applicant.

evs.name: Doctor’s note of approval
evs.description: Doctor’s approval of all necessary medical examinations

evs.name: Medical certificate from a general practitioner
evs.description: Medical certificate issued by a general practitioner confirming the applicant’s fitness to drive, according to the Ministry of Health regulations.

evs.name: Medical certificate from an ophthalmologist
evs.description: Medical certificate issued by an ophthalmologist confirming the adequacy of the applicant’s vision.

evs.name: Proof of payment of fees
evs.description: Receipt proving payment of the required administrative and health-related fees to the Public Treasury and EOPYY for the license renewal process.

evs.name: Passport-type photograph
evs.description: One recent passport-type photograph to be used for the issuance of the new driver’s license.

evs.name: Old driver’s license
evs.description: The old driver’s license that must be submitted and canceled upon completion of the renewal process.

criterion_requirments.name: The applicant must hold a valid driver’s license that requires renewal.
The applicant must have successfully completed the required medical examinations (general practitioner and ophthalmologist).
All required administrative and health-related fees must be paid to the Public Treasury and EOPYY.
The submitted photograph must comply with official passport-type specifications.
The old driver’s license must be returned upon receipt of the new one.
